alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 5:24PM MDT until July 28 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Montezuma, Storrie Lake State Park, Sapello, Gallinas, Mineral Hill, San Geronimo and San Pablo. - This includes the following highways... State Road 94 near Mile Marker 1. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 3. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 13. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 346 and 348. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 4 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the southern portion of the Calf Canyon fire burn area.
